identificationModule.briefTitle: Clinical Evaluation of LEft VEntricular Auto Threshold Algorithm (LEVEA)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Clinical Evaluation of LEft VEntricular Auto Threshold Algorithm

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of the LEVEA study is to assess the performances of a new automatic left ventricular auto threshold (LVAT) algorithm (In-Clinic LVAT algorithm) when used by physicians during in-hospital follow-up.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
"In-Clinic LVAT" feature is a non CE-marked feature designed to be activated by the physician during 2 hospital follow-ups:

* first visit: planned to be conducted 15 days maximum after inclusion
* second visit: planned to be conducted between 1 and 3 months after the first visit The evaluation consists in the comparison between the threshold value provided by the algorithm and the threshold value obtained manually by the physician.

armGroups.label: "In-Clinic LVAT"
armGroups.description: All subject prior to study enrollment has been implanted with a CRT-D device. During follow-ups, under the supervision of the physician, the algorithm embeded in the device is activated with a password. The feature is deactivated at the end of each follow-up.

interventions.name: "In-Clinic LVAT"
interventions.description: Algorithm offers automatic threshold measurement of differents vectors of left ventricular stimulation.
otherNames: Activation of an algorithm in CRT-D device

primaryOutcomes.description: The success rate is defined as the equivalence between the value measured by the algorithm and the measure obtained manually by the physician on 5 identified pacing vectors during the visit among at least 231 LV tests.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Accurate "In-Clinic LVAT" Test Assessed by an Independent Reviewer
secondaryOutcomes.description:
This endpoint is the number of accurate determination of the pacing threshold value provided by the algorithm feature and an independent reviewer, on all available LV pacing vectors at first visit.

An independent reviewer assessed all LV pacing threshold values provided by the algorithm at M0 visit and in all tested configurations

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Successful of "In-Clinic LVAT" Test at M0 Visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: The success rate of "In-Clinic LVAT" feature for all available LV pacing vectors at first follow-up (M0 visit). The method of analysis is similar to the primary endpoint.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Successful "In-Clinic LVAT" Test at M1 Visit
secondaryOutcomes.description: The success rate of "In-Clinic LVAT" feature for all available LV pacing vectors at second follow-up . The method of analysis is similar to the primary endpoint

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Eligible Subjects to LVAT Feature
secondaryOutcomes.description: Identification of the number of subjects who were "eligible" to receive the feature at M0 or M1 visit
Reporting of SAEs, device deficiencies and any suspect behaviour of the algorithm.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: All the 60 patients were assigned to the treatment arm.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Subjects have been included from Feb 16, 2017 to June 2, 2017.

groups.title: "In-Clinic LVAT"
groups.description: 60 patients were included in the single-arm study. The Left Ventricular auto threshold (LVAT) algorithm test was performed at the 2 study visits M0 and M1.

groups.title: "In-Clinic LVAT"
groups.description: Single-arm study design: all the 60 patients were assigned to the treatment arm.

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Successful"In-Clinic LVAT" Test
outcomeMeasures.description: The success rate is defined as the equivalence between the value measured by the algorithm and the measure obtained manually by the physician on 5 identified pacing vectors during the visit among at least 231 LV tests.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription:
Complete LV vector test: test was performed (not aborted or interrupted) and a threshold value is provided by the algorithm.

Successful LV Vector Test: LV threshold value provided by the algorithm compared to the manual threshold is considered "Successful" if the difference is within ± 2 step

groups.title: In-clinic LVAT
groups.description: Patients assigned to the single-arm treatment LVAT. LVAT test performed at M0 and M1 visits.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Accurate "In-Clinic LVAT" Test Assessed by an Independent Reviewer
outcomeMeasures.description:
This endpoint is the number of accurate determination of the pacing threshold value provided by the algorithm feature and an independent reviewer, on all available LV pacing vectors at first visit.

An independent reviewer assessed all LV pacing threshold values provided by the algorithm at M0 visit and in all tested configurations
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription:
Completed LV Vector Test: test was performed (not aborted or interrupted) and a threshold value is provided by the algorithm.

Accurate LV Vector Test: The LV threshold value provided by the algorithm compared to the reviewer assessment is considered accurate if the difference is within ± 1 step.
outcomeMeasures.typeUnitsAnalyzed: Number of completed LV Vector Tests
outcomeMeasures.denomUnitsSelected: Number of completed LV Vector Tests
